website_summaries.verdict: Wobbling chair provides stimulation to fidgety kids.
pros: Available in a wide range of colors
Allows kids to fidget while staying focused and in their seats
Anti-slip rubber bottom and soft foam top
10-inch chairs ideal for kids age 3 to 5 and fit nicely under most tables
cons: Foam seat is easily pierced with a pen or pencil

customer_reviews.title: It’s possible to move while learning
customer_reviews.text: Our daughter that teaches fourth grade had heard these chairs help grade school kids focus to learn. So as a former educator I purchased 4 for her class. They were such a success and could use more chairs.
customer_reviews.author: Pet Gal

customer_reviews.title: Durable, cost-effective seating option for wiggly kids
customer_reviews.text: I purchased to use with students at my school who have difficulty sitting still and attending, or need to work on their postural control. I have used it daily in a preschool classroom; it is durable and this kids like it. The chair has an anti-slip pad on both ends which helps on a tile floor. I would recommend this chair over other similar ones which cost more.
customer_reviews.author: Mary M.

customer_reviews.title: Helpful classroom product.
customer_reviews.text: A very good product for pre-K and K kids that have attention issues. However, you should limit the amount of time, usually about 15-20 minutes, at a time.
customer_reviews.author: marie schoenacker

customer_reviews.title: Second purchase very disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to receive the sectchair that I ordered. My class loved the first one. When I received this one, however, the top part of the chair was in poor condition (the top part keeps popping up despite efforts to push it back into place). What’s even more frustrating is that I have emailed the company twice only to hear nothing back. Very disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Mary M.

customer_reviews.title: Broken in less than 6 months!
customer_reviews.text: Editing my review: After contacting the company, I was sent a full set of replacement chairs, free of charge. I very much appreciate the company making it right. I am truly hoping these new chairs are more durable. These are awful- less than 6 months of use and almost all of them have completely broken. They are no longer safe to use. I am so disappointed and embarrassed that I used a donor’s choose project to fund such poorly made furniture. Am hoping the company can do something to rectify this.
customer_reviews.author: Adelyn Bonner-Lyon

customer_reviews.title: Great work stool for crafts
customer_reviews.text: Added to our kindergarten class for active learning. They fit perfectly under small tables and are easy to stack on the table for cleaning. They wobble just enough to calm 5 and 6 year olds and they can move between them easily without tripping. They are made of a hard plastic and assemble in 2 steps.
customer_reviews.author: TPTA

customer_reviews.title: Good for the wiggles
customer_reviews.text: These work well with 5 year olds. They can wobble and spin. The chair can be tipped on the other side for more stability.
customer_reviews.author: Karin E. Given

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: The kids in my classroom love these seats! We had to start with them upside down until they built up stronger core muscles to use it the correct way. The seats are pretty wobbly...as they are meant to be! I'm planning to purchase more for my classroom soon.
customer_reviews.author: Kami R

customer_reviews.title: A good tool for ADHD
customer_reviews.text: We were introduced to these chairs at my son's school and loved them. It helps keep him focused while working on homework. While not a cure for his ADHD, it is a good tool in our home to help him focus on stationary tasks.
customer_reviews.author: Charles P.

customer_reviews.title: great for kids
customer_reviews.text: Super happy with this! Keeps my son from slouching in his chair.
customer_reviews.author: TS

customer_reviews.title: Great item !!
customer_reviews.text: Works well - other kids at school often want to use it too ! Update : It worked well all school year and it was nice to be able to take it apart to make sure it was fully sanitized. It comes apart easily . Apparently when carried around the classroom it falls apart easily too ! oops - sorry teacher! my child outgrew this version in 5th grade . Clearly it lasts ! Despite it falling apart - only when carried - it was a durable chair for grade 1-5 . I recommend it !
customer_reviews.author: Picky

customer_reviews.title: Durability
customer_reviews.text: Not very big, but fit for kids 3-5 years. Very good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Tatiana_L

customer_reviews.title: Falls apart easily
customer_reviews.text: The bottom base of the stool does not lock into the top part, so when students move them, the bottom falls off and disrupts class. Also, if students put their feet on the bottom base and lean too far, it will slide out from under them and break apart.
customer_reviews.author: mpavo

customer_reviews.title: Active sitting at its best
customer_reviews.text: Great seat for kids that are super active. Relieves the tipping back in their chair issue in a, good way.
customer_reviews.author: Pam In AZ

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed.....DO NOT BUY!!
customer_reviews.text: This is not a good quality. I use it in my 1st grade classroom and they come apart daily. The top cousion comes off and was halfway off when I received it. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this little stool
customer_reviews.text: Love this little stool. Allows my son the opportunity to move while working or eating at his activity table. With a standard table chair he knocked over a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: My kids love these
customer_reviews.text: These seem very durable, they are still holding up to a room full of kindergarteners!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hit of the class room children take turns
customer_reviews.text: Donated to school to help with children who don’t conform to regular desk
customer_reviews.author: Cindy stricklen

customer_reviews.title: Easy and durable
customer_reviews.text: Teacher is happy it seems to help my kid focus
customer_reviews.author: faten el-achi

customer_reviews.title: Good product.
customer_reviews.text: My students love it! Use in the classroom all the time. Holds up great!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Tedford

customer_reviews.title: My students love them! I can't wait to purchase more
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 3 of these for my classroom. My students love them! I can't wait to purchase more! My Kindergarten students have been using them for 1 month and they still look brand new.
customer_reviews.author: Amy H.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Awesome alternative for seating in class. It allows for the wiggles to naturally come out without being a distraction.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The Best!
customer_reviews.text: The students absolutely love these stools! They are a great addition to the flexible seating options in the classroom.
customer_reviews.author: kdors84

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy this stool
customer_reviews.text: Terrible broke after 6 weeks in my classroom! Do not buy !!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Rizzo

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these for my classroom this year to use for my flexible seating. I am very disappointed in the durability of them. They are broken and cracked already and I will not be able to use all of them for next school year. I teach 2nd grade and have very responsible students and clear expectations for all of my seating choices. For the amount of money I spent on these I thought I would get 2-3 years out of them and not be needing to replace the seating option after one year.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Didn't even make it 1 school year!
customer_reviews.text: It is broke- the inside is cracked and will not stay on. These are 40-60 pound first graders, so i am a bit disappointed. I would like a refund or replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great wobble stool.
customer_reviews.text: These have worked great in my classroom, but the bottoms keep falling off.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Energy channeler
customer_reviews.text: My 10-year-old is super fidgety and has to move about even when sitting so I thought I'd give the largest sized wobbly stool a shot. And guess what? It was a huge hit! The box came in. I explained what it was. She assembled it herself (3 pieces and no tools required) and now it helps her channel her energy. She absolutely loves it and I love it because she seems happier and more comfortable and the stool doesn't wear on my carpet like her regular chair did (because of how she used it)! In case you're wondering, her feet do reach the base of the stool and she enjoys the challenge of balancing on the stool.
customer_reviews.author: S. Choy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size for my 8 year old
customer_reviews.text: I bought this stool so that my active son could have somewhere to sit while doing his school work at home. He likes to move around a lot, so I figured something like this would be better than your average chair. It fits him perfectly! It wobbles more than I thought it would, but that's not a big deal at all (he hasn't fallen off or anything). I like that it can slide under the desk when he's not using it too, that way it frees up space in his room. It's very sturdy and literally takes 3 seconds to put together.
customer_reviews.author: Browns

customer_reviews.title: Works for the intended purpose.
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: 10/14 I bought a second one, and in less than 2 full months of use it is now broken. The original one I bought still works fine, I mean, it's cheaply made, I figured that out with the first one, but I've now had the first one and it is still in one piece not broken...so frustrating. Plus, the kid who sits on it, is scrawny. So that isn't the issue either. Original: For the price of this thing you would think it would be made out of better material. But it does the job. I bought it for an incredibly wiggly student and she loves it. She has fallen off of it a few times but she's learned.
customer_reviews.author: Meggera

customer_reviews.title: Just 'ok'
customer_reviews.text: I have had this product in my classroom for the past 5 months. It is used almost every day, but there are a few things that annoy me as a teacher. When kids try to move these wobble chairs around the room to sit at different tables, the bottoms or tops are ALWAYS falling off. It doesn't stay together very well. Also, one of my wobble stools has a crack just from students rocking back and forth in it (which I thought was the purpose of the wobble stools?) The tops of these also are a foam piece which invites kids to stick pencils and other objects into it as a sensory release.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't last long!
customer_reviews.text: I bought five of these for my classroom and they have only been used for 3 months (used the end of last school year and the start of this year, but not over the summer). They have been making a very disruptive clicking noise and when I investigated, I now see that they are all cracked where the stool inserts into the base. This is a huge disappointment considering how expensive these seats are!
customer_reviews.author: Leah S.

customer_reviews.title: Broke After Three Months in My Classroom
customer_reviews.text: I teach students ages 10-12 and my stool broke after only three months. It was great while it was lasted, but now it's going in the garbage. Very disappointing since it wasn't exactly cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this chair! Family Favorite!
customer_reviews.text: ALL of us LOVE this chair! It's so fun for online school work, watching TV, even eating meals for our sensory seeking little. We bought the teen size for our average/smaller size 7 and 5 year olds and it still works fine, not too big or small. We tried the Gaia ball with small legs and that was useless, but this is THE perfect wobble chair. LOVE! LOVE!
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: My daughter with Autism was having a hard time sitting during her hour of speech, we purchased this hoping it would help and it did. She loves being a able to turn and rock. Great purchase if you have a child who needs sensory in put while sitting.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Rakowski

customer_reviews.title: Good Alternative for a wiggly learner
customer_reviews.text: The one thing about this is that it comes apart really easily. When assembling it, it does't snap together, so the kids take it apart and use the parts for their for or pretend weapons when they play super heroes. Other than that it is great. We are doing virtual 2nd grade right now, and had a couple of kid's ikea chairs, but she was complaining that they were uncomfortable, so when she needs something different, she switches to the stool. I like the height. She is still able to get her legs under her small desk, and it seems about right ergonomically (not that I am an expert).
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: Nice chair
customer_reviews.text: Good quality, arrived on time, easy to out together and child loves the movement this gives. No more broken chair legs now from the rocking, this chair is great. Seat could be a bit softer, but true to the website ad. I would order again for another room, I would recommend. Its been a few weeks, will give a refresh on the update soon.
customer_reviews.author: Venus

customer_reviews.title: Not quality
customer_reviews.text: The foam rubber piece that supposed to hold it in the base was torn when I opened it. I went ahead and put it together. However, the base keeps coming off easily. I have purchased 6 of the Kore wobble chairs. 3 I have used 3 years now in my classroom. Never have any ever came apart. I thought I'd save money by buying this one, but not again. I'll stick with Kore brand.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy Cornet

customer_reviews.title: Great buy.
customer_reviews.text: This took 3 minutes out of the box to put together and my 6 year old did most of it. It’s the perfect seat for the wiggles and it has quickly become my daughters go to chair. She is now carrying it around wherever she goes.
customer_reviews.author: LaKeisha

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised but not worth the price
customer_reviews.text: I like the chair and the concept but it is way overpriced. It’s 3 plastic pieces that sit inside one another.
customer_reviews.author: Nonnie0603

customer_reviews.title: Love the purple color! Very durable and provide just the right amount of movement.
customer_reviews.text: I love these so much I bought 4 for my classroom with my own money. All the students want to sit on them at my group table. They rock around, but not enough to be dangerous. The color purple is great, too! Very sturdy and simple.
customer_reviews.author: SonshineDD

customer_reviews.title: kid fall off
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 6yr old for distance learning at home. He likes it because it moves but he has fallen off plenty of times. We have wooden floors. The fact that the chair moves, it gives him the excuse to move even more. I think it's good for a couple of online classes but then we switch to a regular chair because otherwise the kid gets out of control.
customer_reviews.author: Isa Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Great chair, but makes loud, annoying sound
customer_reviews.text: It’s a great chair for fidgety and wiggly kids. Super-easy to assemble and seems sturdy. HOWEVER, it makes this loud, annoying “CLUNK” noise when they move in *just* a right direction with *just* right force. It’s really annoying and distracting especially while they’re e-learning. It’s loud enough that it startled our dog first day or so. I don’t know if it’s defective, or not assembled correctly, or ? It’s annoying enough I thought about returning but with all the retailers sold out of any type of desk chairs I’ll have to keep it for now. Really disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Keiko Holton

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: My 8yr old assembled it herself. I am not sure it’s worth the price, could be cheaper. However, I am told these items are good for kids with sensory issues, ADHD, and vestibular issues etc. she used this in OT and they recommend her to have one so we have it a shot. She’s super excited about it so I’m sure we will get our moneys worth.
customer_reviews.author: Kenisa

customer_reviews.title: Falling apart after 6 days
customer_reviews.text: We literally have had 6 days of distance learning and the “rubberized non slip” grey circle in the bottom has come off. It is no longer going to be safe to sit in on our hard wood floors as it will fall right over when he uses it as intended. Really disappointed and annoyed this product has failed after such a short time frame.
customer_reviews.author: Jav

customer_reviews.title: Too pricey and short for a desk
customer_reviews.text: Too small for a 7 years old and too expensive. My son has ADHD and I though this chair could hel with his attention but I returned because it is too pricey and too short for a desk.
customer_reviews.author: Ml

customer_reviews.title: Simple and Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Our wiggle worm loves this chair. He's able to rock, jiggle and move around, all while sitting down. It's great for kids with ADHD or anyone who needs to move a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great tool..
customer_reviews.text: Terrific idea to help my 10yr old grandson to fidget a little less at the computer. I wish it made him sit up straight but it is better than in a chair. He has complained too hard for his bottom so I’m gonna make a small lad for it. Seems like a lot of money but it’s helping him sit it’s worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Nana

customer_reviews.title: Best wobble chairs.
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these now, and will probably purchase at least one more. My kids love these! So far as I can tell, compared to other wobble seats I've seen in classrooms, these are the best. Super durable, easy to assemble, not heavy, and great for ADHD/ASD/SN kids. I even enjoy sitting on them.
customer_reviews.author: SN Mom

customer_reviews.title: Daughter loves it
customer_reviews.text: This stool is everyone's favorite at my house. They were pretty rough with it when it was new and fun, but it held up and lost it's novelty and now it's just a seat. I needed a light-weight, small-sized stool for my daughter's bedroom and this has been perfect for us. It's easy for them to drag around wherever they need it and the perfect height to use at her desk.
customer_reviews.author: M. Elison

customer_reviews.title: Good chair
customer_reviews.text: Does exactly what I needed—keeps my kids focused during virtual learning! A bit pricey for what they are, but they work!
customer_reviews.author: LG

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what my kiddo needed!
customer_reviews.text: This stool is sturdy, went together quickly and easily and appears to be durable. We've only had it for a week, but my 6 year old has been on it for hours already. He absolutely loves it and it seems to help him get all the wiggles out while we're reading or his making a craft. It will be perfect for the upcoming school year!
customer_reviews.author: Angie Galentine

customer_reviews.title: These are great-
customer_reviews.text: Just right for my average sized 6 YO female child, too tall for my average sized 3.5 YO, I assume that the 6 year old could sit on this from 6-8 years old, tucks easily under their activity table. She seems to like sitting on it, and it lets her get the wiggles out, while still sitting :)
customer_reviews.author: Luli

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed ☹️
customer_reviews.text: The rubber piece to the bottom of chair has come off twice now. Gorilla glue didn’t even hold it on there. It lasted 2months.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids, and teachers too!
customer_reviews.text: This is great for my classroom, and I love it too! I used it all morning during our staff meetings, and it allowed me to focus and move when they continued to drone on! I imagine if it helped me, it will help my students too! 😂
customer_reviews.author: Thatonelady

customer_reviews.title: Falls apart easily after 39 days of use.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my wiggly Kindergartener. It is perfect for him. However, he has only used this for 39 school days and it falls apart easily. He cannot carry it from one station to another without it coming apart. It does stays together while he is seated.
customer_reviews.author: JKL

customer_reviews.title: Very tipsy!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two wobble chairs for my kids for homeschooling. They had used similar chairs when they were enrolled in school, and I thought they would be a great addition to our new homeschool room. They look nice, however, my kids tip over on them almost daily while sitting up straight with their feet on the ground. Myself and my husband have also tipped over. We would really love this product if we felt it was safe, but I'm very nervous my kids will get hurt on them.
customer_reviews.author: Brandy B.

customer_reviews.title: Falls over easily
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my 5 year old son who is about to begin kindergarten from home. While he loves the chair, it just falls right over. In the description, it specifically says it won't tip over, but I don't see how that's possible without filling the bottom with sand or otherwise adding weight to it. I would also get him a taller seat in the future. I purchased the one for 3-5 year olds and at 3'10", he could definitely use the taller seat. It's a great idea and my son has a ton of fun in it, but it seems like a liability if he can fall over so easily.
customer_reviews.author: Carina

customer_reviews.title: Beware of foam top - PENCILS POKE HOLES
customer_reviews.text: Students and pencils don’t mix well with these seats. One student discovered that the foam on top is a fun place to stick a pencil. Other than the foam top, I’m happy with the seats.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Konowal

customer_reviews.title: Liked at first--- until the lever snapped.
customer_reviews.text: Good stool for active kids-- but lever snapped with normal use in less than 1 day of owning. Bummer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, easy to assemble, durable
customer_reviews.text: My granddaughter is a wiggle worm when sitting for on line school. Using this chair, while she still fidgets quite a bit, she is not flipping it over like she would the small chair this replaced.
customer_reviews.author: MSans1

customer_reviews.title: Too Short
customer_reviews.text: Too short for 10-11 year olds who want to sit at an average size desk. Great for sitting around a coffee table though. The stool squeaks and is also really difficult to take apart in order to return. :/
customer_reviews.author: Elise L. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Helps The Kid Who Can't Sit Still (that is like all of them right?!)
customer_reviews.text: Home learning required a lot of purchases--this being one of them. We checked out the other brands, they all seem pretty much the same. We chose this as our son is currently obsessed with Creepers (cave game stuff). So far, he likes it, therefore, we do to! There is not a whole lot to say. Seems durable. Only time will tell!
customer_reviews.author: krp2nte

customer_reviews.title: Not durable, bottom plastic is coming unglued after one month
customer_reviews.text: I bought three of these chairs in quick succession after both kids gave them rave reviews. They are still enjoying but the first one is already falling apart and it’s only a month old. The bottom plastic is coming off. I’ve tried to fix several times but it’s not working. I’m disappointed and hope the other chairs don’t start falling apart too. I thought this would be a great solution for wiggly bodies during remote learning but pretty disappointed in durability. Looks like my return window has closed too.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Flatt

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: The bottom of this chair came off after only having it for 2 months. It’s made a mess on our floor, constantly cleaning it up daily🙁my son absolutely loves it for school! But I would NEVER recommend. Poor quality especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Creativitality

customer_reviews.title: Not durable enough for the classroom
customer_reviews.text: As a teacher I look for durability and economy when shopping for my classroom. Per the ratings I thought these would work, unfortunately I was wrong. The stools didn't make it through the school year. Additionally the one that didn't break kept falling apart. Don't skimp get a Hokki stool instead. They cost more but they are far more durable and more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Tboucher

customer_reviews.title: Not sure about this one...
customer_reviews.text: Not sure it helps...my 4 yr old autistic child does better in his old chair :/
customer_reviews.author: ANNIE

customer_reviews.title: Pqckaaging
customer_reviews.text: It’s a great chair. The only thing is the packaging was delivered ripped apart the good thing is nothing seemed scratched or torn. It needs to be packaged better maybe thicker box.
customer_reviews.author: beauty4life

customer_reviews.title: Help my daughter sit a little longer
customer_reviews.text: Easy assembly but once fall on the floor the bottom part easy to fall apart. You can get some glue or gel to secure it then continue use it without significant change.
customer_reviews.author: Yan Li

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these. One seems to be broken and we have not had them for very long. It is making a loud clicking sound when sat on. Disappointed. The other one seems one fine and the kids love it.
customer_reviews.author: Chan

customer_reviews.title: Great for "fidgety" kids
customer_reviews.text: This really helps my daughter while she works on her computer for school. It is really strong and it was very easy to put together.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: We got this for our 7 year old to use at our desk. It's been a huge hit and she loves being able to move while she does her school work.
customer_reviews.author: erchla

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy wiggle seat
customer_reviews.text: So far it seems very sturdy and durable. My 9 year old sits on it all the time and loves it! It looks like you can turn it over and make it a still seat with the same sensory items for their feet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made breaks in 4 months
customer_reviews.text: I bought the item on April 23rd. The bottom grip peeled off. I tried to glue it on since it was out of the return window. It didn't work. Overall, I'm never buying this product again. I love the chair for the kids but this product costs too much to fall apart in 4 months. I will buy a sturdier product next time.
customer_reviews.author: Rhi

customer_reviews.title: Pretty awesome chair
customer_reviews.text: The chair cane assembled 👍👏YEAH and my Son loves his new desk chair and at the base it has feet massagers to use while your sitting
customer_reviews.author: Mercedes Black

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: This chair does not move smoothly and makes a loud clicking sound. Cannot use it in classroom as intended, due to loud popping sound it makes. Not worth the Price tag...
customer_reviews.author: Lange Family

customer_reviews.title: Great for ADHD
customer_reviews.text: We are homeschooling due to Covid. My 12 year old does not sit still. He loves this chair! I highly recommend for your wobblers
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Wiggles while focusing!
customer_reviews.text: My son uses this during our homeschool sessions. He loves it. Allows him to fidget and move around while still paying attention.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia r. Dawson

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: My son loves it and is looking forward to sitting at his desk when school starts online this fall. It’s perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Couldn’t ask for more!
customer_reviews.text: This chair is perfect for my fourth grader with adhd as we venture into virtual learning this school year!
customer_reviews.author: Miss Amber Rose

customer_reviews.title: Seating for distance learning
customer_reviews.text: Great to help my 5 year old get her fidgeting out while remaining at her desk for distance learning. Unfortunately the rubberized bottom padding fell out in less than a week.
customer_reviews.author: ohshitzuitscharliee

customer_reviews.title: Almost Magic
customer_reviews.text: I have a very active kid and dealing with distance learning had been a struggle until I was recommended this chair. Works almost like magic when they sit in it compared to a regular chair. They're able to focus and still get their wiggles out.
customer_reviews.author: Ramona

customer_reviews.title: Just like at school, now at home
customer_reviews.text: So happy it comes in my daughter's favorite color. Very sturdy and similar to the ones she has at her school.
customer_reviews.author: LJ

customer_reviews.title: Kids love them
customer_reviews.text: The kids love these wobble stools. They are reasonably priced and easy to assemble. My high school students use these and they are very durable!
customer_reviews.author: M.Cote

customer_reviews.title: Helps posture and provides sensory input
customer_reviews.text: Very happy w this stool for remote schooling my 10yo active boy. A wobble stool was suggested by his OT for sensory input and core strength building. We've seen improvements in his posture since he's been using it.
customer_reviews.author: Elise F

customer_reviews.title: Worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Daughter loves it. She does everything in that chair especially her school work.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Ranck

customer_reviews.title: Great stool
customer_reviews.text: This has survived two school years so far. One of the best stools that we bought for our daughter.
customer_reviews.author: JK

customer_reviews.title: Broke with less than a year of use.
customer_reviews.text: Two out of the 6 stools have broken so far. I haven't even had them a full year.
customer_reviews.author: Kerri A. Devin

customer_reviews.title: Not made well
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to get these for my classroom. Unfortunately the base buckled and students fall often. They come apart every time they are picked up. I bought 5 or 6, so disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: kate kelley

customer_reviews.title: Too short
customer_reviews.text: My son is 7 and it’s WAY too short for him. I’m returning it and getting the pre-teen size.
customer_reviews.author: Marisa Cormier

customer_reviews.title: Expected better
customer_reviews.text: We've only used this for 2 weeks when my daughter started remote learning! She scooted the chair over from the floor a little and the bottom stuck to the floor and it came off! Very disappointed! For the amount paid for this chair, it should have been made of better quality! I bought another for my son and hope this does not happen to that one!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not durable
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this chair a month ago and when my 6 year old sits on it now and rolls around, the bottom comes detached. For a $50 chair, it should last more than a month. He has other chairs and doesn’t even sit on it every day. Super disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Brooke K Simpson

customer_reviews.title: my son lives it.
customer_reviews.text: Teacher did not eamt him to use in the class room my son was so excited. Then told me ot was in the teachwr office.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany Gutsche

customer_reviews.title: Kids love it! Quality is ok
customer_reviews.text: 2 months after using in my classroom one of my stools won’t stay together. So far the others are working fine.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. B NC

customer_reviews.title: Won’t hold together
customer_reviews.text: It seems like a good stool if it were one piece and held better. I don’t like how easy it comes apart. My son has pulled it apart and picked at the foam so now it won’t hold at all. It’s almost useless. It won’t stay together.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal M.

customer_reviews.title: Tips over constantly
customer_reviews.text: They stool constantly tips over. It also pops in and out of the connection on the base. Returned
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Madden

customer_reviews.title: Poor glue on bottom rubber
customer_reviews.text: The rubber bottom had partially detached when it arrived. Easily peeled the rest of it off. Lots of glue residue, but did not stay adhered to the rubber side. Easily re-glued the bottom and let it sit overnight. Good otherwise
customer_reviews.author: M. Nupen

customer_reviews.title: Still too tall but works
customer_reviews.text: It’s still a little taller than I hoped for my toddler but it’ll work eventually when he’s a little bigger.
customer_reviews.author: sreynolds09

customer_reviews.title: Bottom rubber piece fell off
customer_reviews.text: The rubber part fell off the bottom within the first week of my students using the chair. Other than that the chair itself is a great wobble chair.
customer_reviews.author: Brooke Foreman

customer_reviews.title: Do not follow the size guidelines-
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my 7 year old. It's way too small! Now I want to return it but I cannot disassemble it.
customer_reviews.author: Nap Merhk

product_meta.title: Active Kids Chair – Wobble Chair Toddlers, Pre-Schoolers - Age Range 3-7y – Grades K-1-2 - 14" High – Flexible Seating Classroom - Helps ADD/ADHD - Corrects Posture - Blue
feature_bullets: STRENGTHENS CORE & CORRECTS POSTURE: Regular chairs allow children to slouch and encourage poor posture that can cause back problems later in life, but this wobble chair for kids ensures boys and girls maintain good posture while naturally engaging their cores for stronger, healthier backs.

HELPS FIDGETY KIDS WITH CONCENTRATION: Kids of all ages are naturally active, and this chair encourages the high energy child to get their wiggles out while remaining in their seat so their activities and studies get done. The best way to help ADD & ADHD kids handle sitting down for long periods.

SOFT CUSHION ON TOP FOR SITTING COMFORT: A comfortable cushioned seat allows your son or daughter to wiggle, wooble, move side-to-side, back and forth without fear of tipping over or landing on the floor. Their bottoms stay comfortable while they balance and work out their restlessness.

NON-SLIP RUBBERIZED BOTTOM KEEPS CHAIR UNDER YOU: Energetic youngsters love this stool that transforms boring, sedentary sitting into calorie-burning activity. The constant movement keeps blood flowing to back and core. Both ergonomic and fun for kids who need to move constantly.

HAPPY CUSTOMERS ONLY: We're so confident that you'll love our product, that we'll give your hard-earned money back if you're not thrilled with your purchase. Simply contact our friendly customer service team to make it right.
